title: Palmarosa Essential Oil

Not a well-known oil, Palmarosa deserves a place in an aromatherapist's chest. It is to your benefit to become more familiar with Palmarosa and its history.Uses of Palmarosa Essential Oil IndiaHistory and Background In Chinese Medicine, Palmarosa is cool and moist in energy. It also clears heat and strengthens yin energy, reinforces the heart yin and calms the mind. We do not know when this plant was first distilled into an essential oil, but once it reached Europe, it was used in perfumery and skin care, including many soaps and facial products. An interesting fact is that Palmarosa was once used as a flavoring for tobacco. Holistically, Palmarosa encourages adaptability and feelings of security, while centering and comforting the heart. Good oil for those who are resistant to change and have difficulty letting go.Physical Description Pale yellow or olive in color with a thin, watery consistency.Aromatic Description Sweet, floral, rosy, and geranium-like aroma.Biological dipentene of fresh or dried grass.Information for Aromatherapists Palmarosa oil is a middle note that blends well with Amyris, Basil, Bergamot, Cananga, Cedarwood, Fennel, Frankincense, Geranium, Lavender, Lemon, Lemongrass, Mandarin, Neroli, Orange, Pine, Rose, Rosemary, Sandalwood and Ylang Ylang.
